title: Sun Holiday Reviews Says Holidaymakers Should Claim Holiday Compensation When Holidays Go Wrong
text:
Online holiday magazine warns holidaymakers not to be put off when holidays have gone bad, and to claim compensation.
Sun Holiday Reviews, an online travel magazine that brings travelers all the latest news is advising consumers to claim compensation when holidays go wrong.
Each year 58% of the adult population in the UK go abroad, with 12 million people visiting Spain. However, not every single holiday goes according to plan and tens of thousands of holidays result in serious complaints. These complaints include serious illness, and holiday accommodation not being what was advertised,
Out of all the holidays that turn into a holiday from hell, only a small percentage of people make a complaint. Out of those complaints, only a small amount end up in legal action being taken against the holiday company. The reason for the low number of complaints is due to consumers not being sure how to make a complaint. According to Sun Holiday Reviews, even fewer people understand they can seek legal advice for holiday complaints.
Geoff Tims from Sun Holiday Reviews Magazine said: "It is important when a person has a complaint about their holiday they seek to claim compensation.”
According to Sun Holiday Reviews , consumers are happy to receive the first offer of compensation from a holiday company when a complaint has been made. This is normally a money off coupon off their next holiday. The average amount according to the travel magazine is around £50, which is not enough when a holiday has been spoilt.
The Sun Holiday Reviews magazine is recommending to holidaymakers who have a serious complaint about their holiday to seek legal advice. By seeking legal advice, they are then able to receive a real compensation amount that will make up for their holiday from hell.
To learn more about Sun Holiday Reviews, please visit http://www.sunholidayreviews.com/
